DOC.brief_title: Protective Manual Hyperinflation Acute Mechanically Ventilated Trauma Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Current evidence mechanical ventilation support `` protective lung strategy '' , small tidal volume prevention loss positive end expiratory pressure ( PEEP ) . There concern manual hyperinflation ( MHI ) may conflict strategy cause volutrauma atelectrauma potentially leading biotrauma . This single-blinded randomized study aim compare two method manual hyperinflation ( protective - moderate tidal volume positive end expiratory pressure ) non-protective ( large tidal volume positive end expiratory pressure ) ventilate acute trauma patient , investigate effect inflammatory marker , lung compliance , oxygenation sputum volume .
DOC.criteria: Trauma patient Day 1 admission intensive care Mechanically ventilate Preexisting lung disease PEEP > 12.5cmH20 Nitric oxide circuit Haemodynamically unstable Undrained pneumothorax Intracranial pressure > 25mmHg
